--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Matthew E. Hoyle" 
<matthewhoyle@w...> wrote:
> Ok here goes: The decoration is of 3 triple diamonds aka 
matsukawabishi
> since they are said to resemble the cracks in pine bark. The gold 
nunome
> decoration looks a bit weird but is probably original. Maybe it has 
worn off
> on most tsuba of this type we see.
> 
> To me it looks like either Kyo Shoami or Kinai school work, going 
on the
> treatment of the rim and the metal used + patina etc etc. Didn't 
the first
> Kinai dude study in Kyoto in the Kyo Shoami style though??? Anyway 
I would
> date it to late in the edo period perhaps 1800 - 1850.
> 
> So how was that then???
> 
> Matt
>
